website_summaries.verdict: Waterproof, warm, and convenient. A high-quality investment and one of the best on the market.
pros: Use in temperatures as low as 22 degrees Fahrenheit
cons: Not designed for extreme winter conditions
Not as roomy as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: but after multiple Fall and Spring camping trips with both a tent and hammock i am still pretty happy with this bag
customer_reviews.text: The 22 degree rating is definitely a survival temp and not a comfort threshold for outdoor use, but after multiple Fall and Spring camping trips with both a tent and hammock i am still pretty happy with this bag. For the average male i would say this will keep you toasty at 35-40 degrees with a sleeping matt or underquilt but starts getting chilly below that. It compresses reasonably well for the average backpacker.
customer_reviews.author: Jeoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Length: Yes... width: he** no
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the zipper in my previous Kelty sleeping bag broke. I chose this one because a) it came in a long size and I am 6'2", and b) I planned on using it in early fall and the foot zipper is a nice feature. BUT, while it is long enough, there is absolutely no point to that length when it is this thin. I couldn't even get the zipper above my waist, let alone ever hoping of fitting my arms inside. Do yourself a favor and keep looking before buying, especially if you plan on getting the long size.
customer_reviews.author: FafnirSpiral

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this bag for a month now and it has out performed my expectations. i am a very warm sleeper and so this bag is great for me down to 0 degrees . I have even slept in it in the 60's and being able to unzip the feet for a vent is awesome. I highly recommend this bag if your looking for lightweight compressible bag with good zipper quality. The bag fits in a medium kelty stuff sack(the red one).
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a week long backpacking trip at high elevation near alpine lakes. The bag is very comfortable but the way the good is designed I usually ended up sleeping with the hood over my face instead of my head...it was freezing so I’m not complaining but when I’d try to switch hood around it was hard. Overall pretty warm. I could do with some more pockets!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: Although I love the look and functionality of this bag, I froze at 31 degrees. The first night I went to sleep with warm socks, sweat pants, shirt, sweatshirt, and hat...definitely not enough! The next night i went to bed with 2 pairs of extra warm socks with hand warmers in them, 3 pants, a tank top, under armour, tshirt, long sleeve shirt, 2 hoodies, a winter hat, and hand warmers in the bag...plus it was 3 degrees warmer. I was very comfortable that night.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t live up to the temp rating.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for my son. On our first trip with the new bag, it did not live up to the degree rating listed. Temperatures dropped to 35 degrees, and he froze the first night. The second I let him use my 20 degree bag and I used his new one. He was right, he froze in his new bag, as did I. The bag is thin, slick, and won’t stand temperatures that’s listed. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy, great quality, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few nights ago (late Oct 2018) in north central az, got to be around 30 or 40f at night. I'd not used a sleeping bag before, so this is my first experience with one, so take that in account when reading this lol. It was chilly enough for most of my fellow campers with lesser quality bags to be uncomfortable. This bag was perfect. Paired with a good sleeping mat underneath I got as good of sleep as I do in my normal bed. Foot box zipper is convenient as well. I plan on buying one of these again in the future for my wife, and would recommend for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Corruptgarage

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: My first 5 rating. Love this bag! Bought two! Slept snug in 37 degree rainy damp nights backpacking on the Kern River in SoCal. Dressed in light long johns, we woke up to snow on the peaks around us and we were cozy. Quality zippers, love the foot vent, and I was toasty enough to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kelty delivers, as always!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, warm and comfy and the foot zipper is great for regulating heat. I have not used this in a camping or backpacking setting but use it for work sleeping in crew apartments all over Montana, some of which are old and cold, so meets my needs perfectly. I would recommend to anyone looking for a good sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great design, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping bag so far. Especially the opening to stick your feet out at night, and the possibility to tie it up and walk around in it! I found it so comfortable that I didn't really want to get out of my bag at all anymore! I haven't used it in really cold temperatures yet so I can't say if it holds up, but at around 10 degrees Celsius it was a bit on the warm side. At which point the possibility to stick your feet out comes in superhandy!
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall people. Bit too pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty expensive for such a tight fit. Great bag for a small person I’m 6’2” and even the larger size kelty was still very tight. I couldn’t move at all. The quality is there in materials but I’m giving it a low comfort rating based on my personal experience. This bag made me realize I can’t do mummy bags lol. But I believe if push came to shove this bag could definitely keep you warm so this review is not a knock on the functionality, but strictly based on comfort from my perspective as a tall & lean 6’ plus change guy.
customer_reviews.author: Hiking with Epilepsy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We backpacked at 10,500' in Colorado and it got down to the high 20's, cold enough to snow on us one morning. I slept with a sweater on, but was warm every night, my wife and daughter on the other hand were always cold. For $100 I was very pleased with these sleeping bags. The next closest thing I could find was for $180! I ordered 6 of these for my family, one of the sleeping bags started coming apart after the first night, but we're in the process of sending it back now. Overall I'd definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Overall my favorite sleeping bag, when it goes on sale it is a great choice and i highly recommend it. PROS: Being able to unzip just the feet during warmer nights is great Size/weight: it's easy to carry and fit into a backpack Stays warm: was comfortable in mid/low 30's For this weight and rating it is a good price CONS: The zipper does get stuck often No compression bag
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: The All rounder
customer_reviews.text: I live in RSA where the winters get cold (close to Zero Celcius) but not FREEZING. I found this to be the ideal sleeping bag as it 'pretty warm' in cold conditions (close to Zero C). The bag stuffs into a fairly compact size and is super light. The bottom zip is great when u want to release ur feet from the bottom. Hidden pouch, good zip, good quality. NEG: I am 192M and I fit in 'OK'. The bag tapers to the feet and this can be a little claustrophobic. This is a camping / traveling bag and NOT a extra long, broad type...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag. I bought this bag to replace a ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag. I bought this bag to replace a very well worn bag I've been backpacking with for years and I couldn't be more satisfied. My favorite feature is the zipper section on the bottom to let my feet breathe. I frequently get warm feet while sleeping and the ability to take my feet out but still have them on top of the soft bag was a great way to fight that. It is slightly larger than I anticipated but still able to pack into my sleeping bag pouch on my backpack no problem. Very soft, very warm, very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but ok
customer_reviews.text: This is comfortable bag for lower temperatures, and in warmer temperatures you got the foot zipper to stick your feet out and get a draft of air. It’s still over 3 lbs and pretty bulky, I was not able to fit it in my compression sack for my previous sleeping bag that is also a 32 degree bag. I suggest looking at the smaller thinner cold weather bags that pack much smaller, and if you’re going for a warmer bag, in most categories of price and siZe and weight you can do better
customer_reviews.author: Macmood

customer_reviews.title: Froze my backside off at 32 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I guess the 22 degree rating means that if you are in this bag and it is 22 degrees you won't die. It certainly does not mean you will be comfortable at 22 degrees. I just did 2 nights at 32 degrees in a tent with a Coleman propane heater and I was freezing all night. I am still alive. If you at looking to simply preserve life this is your bag. If you are looking to be comfortable, you might want to look at another option.
customer_reviews.author: Christiaan Long

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m a cold sleeper and I tried this out in 35° while wearing wool socks and under armor cold gear thermals and was plenty warm. I’m 6’ tall and the tall is perfect. This is a great sleeping bag for the price. It packs down to the size of a down sleeping bag and doesn’t weigh much more either. Definitely a great backpackers sleeping bag if you purchase a compression stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: CesarGPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Colorado and several nights were low 30s and I was very comfortable and occasionally too warm
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular! I have not tried it down to 20 yet, but just went for a trek in W. Colorado and several nights were low 30s and I was very comfortable and occasionally too warm. I never really needed or tried the "Tuck" bit - poking my feet out and such, so I cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: ZotParkerM

customer_reviews.title: Short and tight
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'11" and ordered the regular one. Gave it a test fit when it arrived and found that they must be using metric inches, because I cannot fit in this thing with the top closed up (like you want in the cold). And forget about unzipping it from the inside. I'm returning this one an have ordered the long one - I'll update this review after it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: GreenEgg

customer_reviews.title: Good; make sure to get the longer version!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Not high end but also not super expensive. I went with the slightly smaller version (like $5 cheaper), though as one reviewer below mentions, the width of the bag may be small for some. I'm still a small dude and it should be fine, but I'd still go with the longer version since you get 2 extra inches. I'll update this review after I come back from the Peruvian Andes next month!
customer_reviews.author: Vijay

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping for the value
customer_reviews.text: Just getting into backpacking. This is my first "true" outdoor use sleeping bag. On our first trip, the temperature went down to about 28 degrees. I initially got in with a baclava and fleece jacket in addition to my base layer. It didn't take long for me to need to dress down. I slept in a 3 season tent with no supplemental heat and a 2 inch thick inflatable sleeping mat. This bag kept me warm all night. I also did use a very thin polyester sleeping bag liner which I found to be unnecessary for warmth. Overall, a good bag. I plan to use this bag for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Beckie Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Love This Bag! Very, Very Warm.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Very, very warm. On my last hiking trip it hit about 30 degrees overnight, I still had to take off layers! Rained all night and a little moisture got onto my tent, but the bag was totally dry in the morning. My only complaint is that it takes up a lot of room in my pack, but that's normally what you get with synthetic sleeping bags. A++
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Very warm bag, but zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Long enough for my 6'1" 14-year-old. He said it was very warm- almost too warm for Glacier National Park in early July (40 degrees at night). However, the zipper came apart at the bottom on the first trip he used it. Will be contacting Kelty, since I do not know how to go through Amazon about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie T.

customer_reviews.title: Great 3 season bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old son for use on backpacking and car camping trips. Two weeks ago, we did a 7 mile backpacking trip, with lows in the low 40s. He was quite warm, and unzipped the lower vent to cool off (a great feature). Last weekend, we camped at 7000 feet with lows in the low 30s and he slept warm. Good 3 season bag at a bargain price. Doesn't compress as tightly as higher-priced down-filled bags, but that was expected. With proper care, this bag should last him for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny 5

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a 22 degree bag. We were in the 40s and were cold. Also the zippers stick on both of the bags I bought. One of my sleeping bags the inside is showing as a spot on the bottom wasn't sewn right.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S.

customer_reviews.title: Zipper tear on first use
customer_reviews.text: I took this bag camping and used it for the first time. It was comfortable and kept me warm with lows around 40 degrees. I'm not sure when it happened but when I was putting back in stuff sack while packing up to go I noticed a tear along the zipper seam. Not sure at what point during the trip this occurred but it is unacceptable. There was no heavy use just simple zipping and unzipping. Unfortunately my 1 month return window expired by the time I used the bag, otherwise I would definitely return.
customer_reviews.author: James Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and packs small
customer_reviews.text: happy with this bag for the price.you will not be warm at 22 degrees though. i've used in high 20's, but needed warm clothes plus a thin liner to be comfortable. also packs small. overall happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over my 15 degree coleman.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Since buying it, I have slept outside for 4 nights in a hammock. 2 nights in Utah with temps down to 30, and 2 nights in Baxter State Park with similiar lows. Way better than what I was using before, plus it looks snazzy! I run warm during the day but can get chilly at night outside. I slept in shorts and a light longsleeve and was never cold. I am satisfied with this purchase. The zipper by your feet is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great bag at a great price...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to take on his trip to Philmont. He loves this bag, especially the zipper at the feet. It is a little bulkier than some backpacking sleeping bags but still fit in sleeping bag compartment at the bottom of his Gregory backpacking backpack. It kept him warm on his entire trip. I would recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina L Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag for around 110 or 119. Very comfortable for me (6'1"). Went to Mountains in northern NM and had sub freezing temps the first night. This did get me too cold even with wool socks, shorts and a shirt on. I like the extra pocket inside that does not let things slip out. I also love the opening at the bottom that I did use on another warmer night. Great bag overall.
customer_reviews.author: Sam the Man

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bag is small enough to bring backpacking (although you’ll want to use a compression sack or straps to compress the bag down further than the stuff sack it comes with) and warm enough to use in 40 degree temps. You won’t find many backpacking sleeping bags of this quality in the same price range. To get a comparable bag you’ll most likely end up spending in the $200 range, and this one goes for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: N8ure

customer_reviews.title: Great "mummy" bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this at Amazon but the package was lost since they delivered on a holiday weekend (sunday) Despite i said not too. I needed it for camping and i couldnt get a replacement order in time i had to get this from a local store (blahh). Despite that hiccup, i love this bag. Works wonderful. Kept me warm. I like to sleep on the "cool" side. The pocket on the inside is nice to keep your phone and love how you can unzip where your feet are. I plan to use it for my backpacking trips coming up this fall in Colorado. ITs not super light but not heavy either. Fits in my pack just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: LIKE EVERYTHING BUT THE LOWER ZIPPER PULL.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice bag. Used Kelty packs extensively in the 60's and 70's in backpacking. The reason I returned it is because of the zipper at the low end of the bag. I doesn't smoothly open and nearly pulls off of the track. Shouldn't happen on a brand new bag.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Love this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag! Well-constructed, warm, comfy, and with some fun features. The media pocket is great, especially for keeping your phone warm against your body overnight to save the battery. The bottom zipper allows you to kick your feet out if you're a bit warm. Really helpful, especially in the morning when the sun may heat up the tent a little bit. The sleeping bag is a good middle ground for car camping or some short hikes. I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: C&S

customer_reviews.title: not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: i am in very cold environments.This bag was awesome at first and warm. however after a few months and few washes it failed to maintain its ability to retain heat. Had to purchase a more costly bad with a warranty and long term quality standards.his bad is great if your going to use it a few days on a two day get away might last years but if you sleep in it often not gonna keep warm over a long period after about 3 to 4 months id say its not good in 40 to 50 degree temps anylonger
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently completed the 5-day, 50-mile pack back trip called the Rocky Mountain Marathon with the group called Voice of Wilderness and I am so glad I had this bag. It kept me comfortable all night, every night of the trip. I especially like the zipper at the feet to use as a "thermostat".
customer_reviews.author: Walt J.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to roll up
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is light, but warm enough for spring/fall weather. It is easy to unfold and fold back up. What I did not like about it is the narrow leg area. Since I tend to toss and turn a lot at night this became a real inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Great cold weather sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I hiked the Georgia section of the appalachian trail with this sleeping bag during April. It was perfect for the weather and the I couldn't believe how small this sleeping bag compressed down. Very small cubic volume. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Genuine Cause

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag for tent camping
customer_reviews.text: My wife used to feel cold every time during tent camping so we decided to buy a new one with 20F and mummy shape. It turns out to be a good choice, now she basically never says cold again in our recent camping. The night temperature usually doesn't go below 30F but still the sleeping bag is proven to be very effective
customer_reviews.author: Jian Zhou

customer_reviews.title: It’s not worth the misery of not sleeping.
customer_reviews.text: 5’10” 215 lbs. I’ve had mummy bags before and haven’t had issues being comfortable. Although this bag has many great features, the benefits offered pale in comparison to how miserable it was at reaching its primary function...achieving sleep. Do not buy this bag if you are concerned about restful sleep. Feature = A foot box that can be unzipped. Advantage = unzip and cool down. Benefit = NONE. GOOD LUCK EXITING THIS TRAP WITHOUT SURGICAL EQUIPMENT.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Powell

customer_reviews.title: Foot vents are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We've used these extensively now for well over 2 months of sleeping outdoors in everything from snowy nights, all the way up to 104 degree f nights in the Mojave desert. These are some of the best value sleeping bags on the market. The foot vents are a life saver when it's warm out and when it's cold these keep you nice and toasty. A must have in our camping kit.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Slept in this when the temps were about 34 degrees and I stayed warm. Anything colder and I would have needed some thermal underwear or something. Great bag, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ultra Runner

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this sleeping bag. I have tested it in about 30 degree Fahrenheit weather and have stayed comfortable. The stuff sack it comes with isn’t the greatest because it doesn’t have any compression straps so I bought a separate compression bag for it and it packs down pretty small with the new sack.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Turrentine

customer_reviews.title: I have more good than bad to say.
customer_reviews.text: This is the bag I wanted since I first started looking into backpacking! It keeps me warm! I love the ability to kick my feet out and even wear it around camp. However, it is very tight! I’m five feet ten inches tall and about 225#s and this fits me very tight. Any tighter and it would be uncomfortable. I’m happy with it over all but I was a little let down on how little space there was once inside.
customer_reviews.author: GoDavyGo/GoCassGo

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be more satisfied with this bag
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting until I used this a couple times before a review. I have reached that point! I couldn't be more satisfied with this bag. Kept me warm on nights that got to 30 degrees. Lightweight and compacts well!
customer_reviews.author: kolby kirk

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Too-long-didn't-read version: Pros: Warm, comfortable, compressible, footbox vent zipper, comes with a stuff sack, affordable, internal storage pocket Cons: Zipper gets caught on the draft tube sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Dang Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Packs big not small!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say doooooo NOT buy this for a backpacking trip. Do not. It is way to big and too heavy to be put inside a pack. Don’t listen to anyone saying this is a great sleeping bag for back packing. No it is not. Other than that idk. I returned it because it’s big af.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness you can open the zipper from the bottom and let your feet cool a little
customer_reviews.text: The first night I used this bag the temp dropped clear to 53 degrees! Thank goodness you can open the zipper from the bottom and let your feet cool a little. This is my first Mummy style sleeping bag, takes a little getting used to but it packs tight and keeps me warm and comfy at night. I've spent two nights in it at 34-36 degrees, excellent!
customer_reviews.author: ST13PILOT

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a versatile 3 season bag (not winter), that can handle cold mountain weather. Very comfortable and functional. Just used at 35 degrees and not to hot nor cold. Internal baffles work well. Hood is great. Expected Kelty quality. 5'11" using the long, paired with the Thermarest Luxury Map. Regular was to tight in the shoulders. Multiple hanging points. Very satisfied! Also surprised cause it is not much heavier than my Kelty summer bag and stuffed size is fairly small.
customer_reviews.author: C.A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Bought for son, 13 yrs old. Excellent. Warm and comfy (he says). While in the summer time he felt hot (indoor use)So definitely good insulation. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hidemi

customer_reviews.title: Good design, well made
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the design of the zipper placement at the bottom so that I can stick my feet out if I get warm (and this is a warm bag). Super easy to go in and out to regulate temp. Very well made bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for motorcycle camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He needed light weight, compact sleeping bag for MC ride/camping trip across the desert. Temps at night were only around 50 degrees but he said it kept him warm
customer_reviews.author: Shopping’ Fool

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but not 22'.
customer_reviews.text: This bag did exactly as I expected. I needed to wear thermals at night with temps approaching 30', but the bag was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.text: Took this last week to Glacier Nat Park! I got snow, wind, rain ... you name it. But sleeping in this bag kept me really warm. A couple nites I actually slept on top. Very well made, with no snag zippers and the inside pocket was a surprise that came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Chad SanbornTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, Narrow in the shoulders...for me
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag seemed good quality, but was too narrow in the shoulders for me. I’m 6’3 220lbs, and do have broad shoulders...tried over several days and just couldn’t get used to how restrictive it was across the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Dortch

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this bag
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this bag! My only complaint is it is too warm ... if the weather is above 30 degrees, you will sweat. This bag is warm and comfy but use in appropriate weather. I will buy the Kelty 50 degree and keep this for colder outings. No regrets ... love it!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy for a mummy style bag. I get really hot so the ability to vent the bottom is great for regulating the temp on warmer nights.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I'd rate it closer to 35 or 40 degree
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but it gets nice and small. It is actually comfortable for such a small bag. I slept out in 35 degree weather and was a bit cold. Mostly my feet. But with some good wool socks I would have been fine
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Broken Zipper
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product a few times while camping. Kelty boasts about its improved zipper technology. I was very disappointed in this product. I ended up having to buy a new one. Steer clear of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The bag is light and reasonably compact. I was amazed at how warm it is. In fact, for me, in the summer, it was too warm, so I used the foot zipper feature to cool my feet and even when the temps dropped all I had to do was zip up. I think it's a fantastic value at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ed instead

customer_reviews.title: ... restrictive at the shoulders when fully zipped which is good for keeping in warmth but might be a problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a little restrictive at the shoulders when fully zipped which is good for keeping in warmth but might be a problem for people with a wider frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Really does keep you warm in 22 degree weather
customer_reviews.text: I went on a camping trip in the mountains where the low at night was 25 degrees and windy. This sleeping bag kept me toasty!
customer_reviews.author: GetRDone

customer_reviews.title: Foot zipper!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s absolutely perfect! I’m 5’7”, 129lbs and the regular size is a great fit! The open foot zip is my favorite part, you can’t go wrong with this bag. Ideal for those non-blanket sharing nights watching a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren E.

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable mummy bag
customer_reviews.text: Great, decently compact, wouldn't want to experience 22F in it but with a liner I'm sure it could do the job. Like that it can unzip from the bottom as well. More useful than you'd think.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: A good lightweright bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag. If it's not super cold outside the bag is a bit too warm for anything above 50 degrees but I used it in some under 30 degree nights and it kept me warm with clothes layered.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Good bag cheap price tag
customer_reviews.text: Like the bag a lot it’s long for sure. Came very fast. I’m about to use this weekend in 10 degree weather I’ll leave another review when I’m back from my hunting trip.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great value
customer_reviews.text: For a synthetic it's near one of the best-especially for the value. The sleeping bag is comfortable, lightweight (all considering), and of good quality. Keeps me very warm and the convenience of the zippered foot area is beyond grand (wish more manufacturers did this). Overall, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: zipper broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: My son took this sleeping bag on three Boy Scout overnight camping trips. On the third one, the entire zipper pull mechanism came off and he was outside in 40 degree weather with a sleeping bag that couldn't be zipped up. I will not buy a Kelty sleeping bag again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apparently, you must check brand new items from this company when you receive it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the brand new to take in a hiking trip. On day one I opened it up to find a big hole in the lining. Tried to return it but it was 30 days out before using it, so it was a total loss of $100.
customer_reviews.author: Gina W.

customer_reviews.title: Get this bag.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I use the foot zipper all the time. I am 6'2" and a pretty big guy. I ordered the Long and it works spectacularly. It is very warm and a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Braxton

customer_reviews.title: 70% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: 70% anticipation reached. Need more to keep warm even at 35F.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Super warm at 30 degrees I'm sure that it will keep me from being cold at the rated 22 degrees
customer_reviews.author: they call me tater salad

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and great quality
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is amazing! I took it on a camping trip to <30 degrees with my family and it was soft, warm, and very comfortable. Great price for a good product. Very lightweight as well.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpacking Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a year and a half now, and this sleeping bag continues to deliver. Lightweight, and warm when you need it. I couldn't ask for anything more. Easily one of the best backpacking sleeping bags you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Auston

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable. The ability to let my feet breathe worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Warm and comfortable. The ability to let my feet breathe worked very well in keeping my temperature regulated. Zipper worked well also.
customer_reviews.author: Thinblueline

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. There's some minor snagging with the zipper, but not a real issue. It's pretty warm, and the zipper vent at the bottom is great for warmer nights.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: but I think into the 30s it should be fine.
customer_reviews.text: I only used this once so far and it was around 40 degrees out with gale force winds. I was afraid my tent was going to collapse, but the bag kept me toasty warm. I don't know how it would do down at the 20 degree mark, but I think into the 30s it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on an extended Deer and Elk hunt in the backcountry
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great, lightweight, small pack size. I used this this last week on an high back country Elk and Deer hunt and it worked great. I got a bit cold but it probably dipped below the temperature rating for the bag. Probably should have bought the 0 degree but not the bags fault...
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Made for an excited son on Christmas. Now let's get camping.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL MCQUIVEY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for my wife
customer_reviews.text: The wife loves this sleeping bag. Good camping bag, works okay for backcountry, but is not as small as we would like. But we knew that when we purchased the bag. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: Corbin Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great all around bag
customer_reviews.text: Compresses great. Light weight. Without a pad and comfortably sleep to mid 30’s. With a pad I’ve slept great down to the low 20s
customer_reviews.author: hshe

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My first stuff sack and it was a good one! Small and lightweight was very comfortable. More like 30 degrees. I slept on the mountain range bordering Idaho and Montana and it was below freezing
customer_reviews.author: ChanceD

customer_reviews.title: really nice quality and kept me warm on a 40degree night
customer_reviews.text: really nice quality and kept me warm on a 40degree night. really love the feet hole for walking around in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 3 season bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! As soon as I got inside of it - I could feel my body heat warming the bag. Definitely going to keep me warm in the cooler nights. The open toe area is great. Cool down without getting out the bag. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: maldonadocv

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is non functional
customer_reviews.text: It’s warm and fairly compact and lightweight. However the zipper constantly gets suck and separates. I can’t believe a sleeping bag at this price has such a terrible zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Warm, not too heavy, won’t break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Hiked around the porcupine mountains in the fall ( HIGHLY recommend) anyway was looking for something light weight and that wasn’t going to break the bank but would keep me warm. Highly satisfied with this bag and so is my boyfriend who has one himself.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Braden

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty but didn’t come with the compression bag
customer_reviews.text: The product seems pretty good so far, although the packed bag was way bigger than I expected and I didn’t received the compression bag which makes it very inconvenient as it takes so much space in my backpack and i leave on three days to my trip!... I’ll upload the information as I get an answer...
customer_reviews.author: ryan pitts

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and well-made. It's a bit big in the stuff sack, but you should be using a compression sack for your sleeping bag anyway. It gets really compact in a medium compression sack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: this was a Christmas present for my grandson. He used it for Wintercamp. it kept him warm. I was happy with the price and quality. I believe that it will serve him well for many years assuming he takes reasonable care of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: It does well at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Well made bag.Has solid zippers and comfortable well into the lower 30 to upper 20s. The bag is a bit room so if you're smaller it wont be as comfortable in lower temps.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Krieg

customer_reviews.title: This is my first mummy bag and used it the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mummy bag and used it the first time and it got down to the 30s at night. I was toasty!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa V.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good quality. Just a little too tight for my liking
customer_reviews.author: BuyByBirdy

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for 5'10"
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Really warm. I've used it down to around 45 degrees and it works great. Not sure about below that yet though! Its snug but comfortable. I'm 5'10" and 200lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nang L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm in 20 degree weather in Sequoia National Forest.
customer_reviews.author: A Confused User

customer_reviews.title: Warm in my hammock
customer_reviews.text: I slept in this for 3 nights while deer hunting. Stayed warm in my hammock and bagged a buck on day 3!
customer_reviews.author: Sid (Vicious)

customer_reviews.title: Bag arrived damaged :(
customer_reviews.text: Found the bag to be ripped upon arrival 😩 I am going on a camping trip in the morning and don’t have time to return and get a replacement. Everything else seems great and I’m excited to try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The item was very thin and not very warm in 30 degree weather. After one wash a seam had busted loose and messed up the zipper
customer_reviews.author: yancey morgan

customer_reviews.title: Warm but cheap zipper
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to like this sleeping bag, it did a good job keeping me warm even after the zipper failed, but the zipper failed on my first outing with it so unfortunately I cant trust it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Yep! Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Though my toes got a bit chilly (wool socks helped) for the money this is a very solid bag. Compresses super small and seems to be constructed well. I'd say the 22 degree rating is about correct.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lewis

product_meta.title: Kelty Tuck 22F Degree Mummy Sleeping Bag – 3 Season Ultralight Sleeping Bag with Thermal Pocket Hood, Zippered Opening in Footbox. Lightweight Traveling Backpacking Tent/Hammock Camping Sleep System – Stuff Sack Included
product_meta.description:
Kelty Tuck 20 / EN 22 Sleeping Bag
Like being comfortable outdoors? It’s hard not to have an affinity for the fully featured, highly versatile Tuck 20°F sleeping bag. Filled with performance ThermaPro insulation that’s designed to retain warmth and easily compress, this bag takes synthetic fiber blend to a whole other level. There’s even a unique comfort tuck that you can unzip, to put your feet out camping on a warmer night. Wherever you’re going, this is sure to become your go-to bag. 

 Features: 

 * ThermaPro Insulation with EN Lower Limited Rating: 22° F / -6° C 
 * Comfort-Tuck Zipper System with foot vent 
 * Thermal-comfort hood and natural fit footbox 
 * Media-integrated storage pocket 
 * Offset quilt construction 
 * Zipper draft tube with antisnag design 
 * FatMan and Ribbon drawcords 
 * Stuff sack included 
 *  
   Specifications: 
 * EN Lower Limit Rating: 22° F / -6° C 
 * Insulation: ThermaPro Synthetic 
 * Shell Material: 75D Polyester Taffeta 
 * Liner Material: 75D Polyester Taffeta 
 *  
   Size Regular: 
 * Fits to: 6 ft / 183 cm 
 * Fill weight: 31 oz. / .88 kg 
 * Total weight: 3 lbs / 1.36 kg 
 * Stuffed size: 9" x 15" / 23 x 38 cm 
 *  
   Size Long: 
 * Fits to: 6 ft 6 in. / 198 cm 
 * Fill weight: 33 oz. / .94 kg 
 * Total weight: 3 lbs 3 oz. / 1.45 kg 
 * Stuffed size: 9"x 15" / 23 x 38 cm
feature_bullets: The perfect blend of warmth and compressibility. Thermatron is a fiber blend engineered to retain warmth & provide superior pack ability. A synthetic backpacking bag with enough comfort features, it will quickly become your go-to camping necessity
Comfort Tuck: Easily pull one or both feet out on warmer nights, or keep it zipped tight for toasty toes when the temperature drops
Thermal-comfort hood and natural fit footboy, Zipper draft tube with antismog design
75D Polyester Taffeta Shell + 75D Polyester Taffeta Liner + Thermatron Insulation + Comfort-Tuck Zipper System
Media-integrated storage pocket + Offset quilt construction + Zipper draft tube with anti-snag design
Regular: Fits to 6 ft. Long: Fits to 6ft 6in
